--- In junit@egroups.com, "Egger, Wolfgang" <beuys@e...> wrote:
Hello,

I have done quite a bit of testing with EJB's and RMI objects
(Java).

Testing a distributed system is just like testing anyother system.
As the client, ask yourself :

How do I know if the system is working?
Did I get my remote stub?
Did the stub return the correct output when I asked it to perform
an opertation?
Did I connect to the db?
Did I get the correct bank balance (or whatever your business logic
does if you have any)?

Any time a question pops into your head try to write a test for it.
The fact that the object lives on another network, in another VM
does not matter.

Cheers

Jonathan
